description: Number of primes between successive Lucas numbers.
example: Between Luc(7)=29 and Luc(8)=47 we find the following primes: 31, 37, 41 and 43 hence a(7)=4.
prog: (Haskell)a052012 n = a052012_list !! (n-1)a052012_list = c 1 0 $ tail a000204_list where  c x y ls'@(l:ls) | x < l     = c (x+1) (y + a010051 x) ls'                   | otherwise = y : c (x+1) 0 ls-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 18 2011
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Nov 15 1999
